title: The Engagement
description: Dorothy, Rose, and Blanche are three women who share a house in Miami, Florida. Dorothy's elderly mother, Sophia, unexpectedly moves in after her retirement home burns down, and Blanche accepts a proposal of marriage.

title: Guess Who's Coming to the Wedding?
description: When Dorothy's daughter Kate gets married, Dorothy must confront her ex-husband Stanley, who walked out on their 38 year marriage for a younger woman.

title: Rose the Prude
description: Rose is afraid of sexual intimacy with her boyfriend, Arnie, because she feels she would be cheating on her late husband, Charlie.

title: Transplant
description: Blanche's sister, Virginia, with whom she has had a tense relationship for years, comes to visit. She reveals that she needs a kidney transplant to save her life.

title: The Triangle
description: When Dorothy's doctor boyfriend makes a pass at Blanche, their friendship becomes threatened.

title: On Golden Girls
description: Blanche's belligerent grandson David comes to visit.

title: The Competition
description: The girls' friendship is tested by a bowling tournament.

title: Break In
description: Rose feels unsafe in her own house after a burglary.

title: Blanche and the Younger Man
description: Blanche dates an aerobics instructor who is considerably younger than she is. Meanwhile, Rose's mother comes to visit and resents the way her daughter treats her.

title: The Heart Attack
description: Sophia falls ill suddenly, and the other girls worry she may be having a heart attack.

title: The Return of Dorothy's Ex
description: Stan returns to try and make amends with Dorothy.

title: The Custody Battle
description: Dorothy's wealthy sister Gloria wants Sophia to move to California with her.

title: A Little Romance
description: Rose doesn't tell her friends that her boyfriend is a dwarf because she fears people will make fun of them.

title: That Was No Lady
description: Dorothy's affair with a married co-worker meets with disapproval from her friends and her mother.

title: In a Bed of Rose's
description: After Rose's boyfriend Al dies of a heart attack in her bed, Rose fears that she is a death jinx in the bedroom because her beloved husband Charlie died of a heart attack in her bed as well. To make matters worse, after Rose tracks down Al's sister to notify her of his death, she comes to find that his "sister" is really in fact his wife!

title: The Truth Will Out
description: Rose goes over her last will and testament with her daughter, who is shocked when she learns what happened to her expected inheritance.

title: Nice and Easy
description: Blanche is concerned about the flirtatious behavior of her niece, Lucy.

title: The Operation
description: Dorothy is afraid to have an operation for a benign growth on her foot.

title: Second Motherhood
description: A wealthy widower with two young children asks Blanche to marry him.

title: Adult Education
description: An adult education teacher offers Blanche a passing grade in his course if she sleeps with him.

title: Flu Attack
description: Dorothy, Rose, and Blanche all come down with the flu at the same time.

title: Job Hunting
description: Rose loses her job and has trouble finding another one.

title: Blind Ambitions
description: Rose's sister Lily must come to terms with the fact that she is blind and needs assistance.

title: Big Daddy
description: Blanche's father, "Big Daddy" Hollingsworth, visits with the news that he's sold his house and wants to become a singer. Meanwhile, a boundary dispute over a fallen tree leads Sophia to put a curse on the rude neighbor who refuses to move it.

title: The Way We Met
description: The girls remember how they came to live together; Blanche put an ad for a room for rent on a grocery store bulletin board, and Rose and Dorothy answered it.

title: End of the Curse
description: Blanche believes she is pregnant. When she turns out not to be pregnant, but going through menopause, she believes her life is over.

title: Ladies of the Evening
description: Dorothy, Rose, and Blanche win tickets to attend a post-premiere movie party with Burt Reynolds. However, a hitch in their plan occurs when they are mistaken for prostitutes.

title: Take Him, He's Mine
description: Blanche goes on a date with Stan as a favor to Dorothy, who is shocked and upset when the two of them actually have a good time.

title: It's a Miserable Life
description: Rose's petition to save a very old tree attracts the ire of Freida Claxton, a misanthropic old woman on whose property the tree lies. At a public hearing, Rose gets angry at Mrs. Claxton and tells her to "drop dead," which she does. Rose blames herself for Mrs. Claxton's death, so the girls decide to pay her one final act of kindness.

title: Isn't It Romantic?
description: Dorothy's lesbian friend Jean develops a crush on Rose.

title: Big Daddy's Little Lady
description: Blanche's father reveals that he is getting married. Meanwhile, Dorothy and Rose enter a songwriting contest.

title: Family Affair
description: Rose's daughter Bridget has an affair with Dorothy's son Michael.

title: Vacation
description: Dorothy, Rose, and Blanche's vacation to a tropical island is a complete disaster. Meanwhile, Sophia befriends a Japanese gardener who speaks almost no English.

title: Joust Between Friends
description: When Dorothy gets a job at the art museum where Blanche also works, tensions grow between the two of them.

title: Love, Rose
description: Dorothy and Blanche make up a fictional man who "responds" to Rose's personals ad.

title: 'Twas the Nightmare Before Christmas
description: The girls all plan to visit their respective families for Christmas, but their plans are ruined when they are held hostage by a man dressed as Santa Claus at the Grief Counseling Center.

title: The Sisters
description: Dorothy invites Sophia's sister Angela to visit, not knowing that the two of them hate each other.

title: The Stan Who Came to Dinner
description: Stan takes advantage of the girls' hospitality while recovering from heart surgery.

title: The Actor
description: A famous actor in town for a local play tries to carry on separate, clandestine affairs with Dorothy, Rose, and Blanche at the same time.

title: Before and After
description: Rose's behavior changes after she says that she died from a throat spasm while in the hospital.

title: And Then There Was One
description: The girls believe that an infant entrusted to their care by a couple during a marathon has been abandoned.

title: Bedtime Story
description: As the girls figure out how they plan to accommodate some upcoming guests, they recall other unusual sleeping arrangements they've had to endure in the past.

title: Forgive Me, Father
description: A teacher to whom Dorothy is attracted turns out to be a priest.

title: Long Day's Journey Into Marinara
description: Sophia believes her sister Angela is trying to steal her boyfriend from her.

title: Whose Face Is This, Anyway?
description: The other graduates at Blanche's high school reunion make her feel her looks have faded, and she decides to have plastic surgery.

title: Dorothy's Prized Pupil
description: One of Dorothy's students writes a prize-winning essay on what it means to be an American. After this, the Department of Immigration and Naturalization Services reveals that the boy is in this country illegally.

title: Diamond in the Rough
description: Blanche is bothered by her boyfriend's lack of polish and social graces.

title: Son-in-Law Dearest
description: Dorothy's daughter Kate visits with the news that her husband has cheated on her and she is leaving him.

title: To Catch a Neighbor
description: Two police officers stake out in the girls' house to investigate their neighbors, who are suspected jewel thieves.

title: A Piece of Cake
description: As they plan a surprise birthday party for a friend, the girls recall prior birthday celebrations.

title: Empty Nests
description: Paul Dooley and Rita Moreno guest star as neighbors of Blanche, Dorothy, Rose and Sophia contending with family and friends in this initial spin-off pilot of "Empty Nest."

title: Old Friends
description: Sophia befriends an elderly man who suffers from Alzheimer's disease. Meanwhile, Rose tries to get her teddy bear back from one of her Sunshine Cadets, who holds it hostage.

title: One for the Money
description: The girls recollect past attempts at starting their own businesses.

title: Bringing Up Baby
description: Rose's uncle Hingeblotter dies and leaves Baby, his 29-year-old prize-winning pig, to her. The other girls object until they learn about the cash they will receive if they take care of the animal until it dies.

title: The Housekeeper
description: The girls believe that a housekeeper that they fired has put a curse on them.

title: Nothing to Fear, But Fear Itself
description: Rose's aunt's funeral provides an opportunity for her, Dorothy, and Blanche to cope with some of their phobias.

title: Letter to Gorbachev
description: Rose is concerned about nuclear war, so she writes letters to both Soviet Premier Mikhail Gorbachev and US President Ronald Reagan expressing her fears. Thinking it to be a heartfelt letter from a little girl, a Soviet emissary is so touched by the letter that he arranges a press conference to have "little Rose" read it publicly.

title: Strange Bedfellows
description: A politician running for city council claims that Blanche slept with him.

title: Brotherly Love
description: Dorothy goes out on a date with Stan's brother Ted.

title: A Visit from Little Sven
description: Although he is engaged to be married, Rose's cousin Sven falls in love with Blanche.

title: The Audit
description: Dorothy and Stan owe $5,000 to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Three on a Couch
description: The girls go to group therapy to deal with the growing problems in their friendship.

title: Charlie's Buddy
description: Rose is smitten when an old army buddy of Charlie's arrives at her door with eyes only for her but the other girls are suspicious of his intentions.

title: The Artist
description: Blanche, Rose, and Dorothy find themselves vying for the attention of the same artist, while Sophia takes up practical joking.

title: Blanche's Little Girl
description: Blanche sees her daughter Rebecca for the first time in three years. When she learns her daughter is engaged to a man who mistreats her, she is afraid to speak out for fear of destroying their relationship again.

title: Dorothy's New Friend
description: Dorothy's friend, local author Barbara Thorndyke, treats Rose and Blanche condescendingly.

title: Grab That Dough
description: The girls go to Hollywood to appear on the TV game show "Grab that Dough."

title: My Brother, My Father
description: When Sophia's brother Angelo, a priest, comes to visit, she makes Dorothy and Stan pretend that they are still married.

title: Golden Moments: Part 1
description: Sophia decides to move out of the house and live with her son Phil.

title: Golden Moments: Part 2
description: Dorothy, Rose, and Blanche try to convince Sophia not to move away.

title: And Ma Makes Three
description: Sophia, depressed over the departure of her best friend, becomes a third wheel in Dorothy's promising relationship with a new boyfriend.

title: Larceny and Old Lace
description: Sophia believes that her boyfriend Rocco, who claims to be a retired gangster, has robbed a bank to impress her.

title: Rose's Big Adventure
description: Rose tries to light a fire under her newly-retired boyfriend who has become a couch potato. But she's not sure she wants to go along when he decides to sail around the world. Meanwhile, the ladies' attempt to convert the garage into a guest room faces many obstacles.

title: Mixed Blessings
description: Dorothy's son Michael is engaged to a black woman who is twice his age.

title: Mister Terrific
description: Rose must persuade a kids' TV show host not to kill himself after he is fired.

title: Mother's Day
description: On Mother's Day, the girls, who are all mothers themselves, recall past celebrations of the day.

title: Yes, We Have No Havanas
description: Blanche and Sophia are caught in a love triangle with an elderly Cuban cigar mogul.

title: The Days and Nights of Sophia Petrillo
description: While Dorothy, Rose, and Blanche sit around and feel like their lives are boring, Sophia goes out and fights with the grocery store over a peach, conducts a jazz band made up of old ladies, and volunteers at the hospital.

title: The One That Got Away
description: Blanches tries to woo Ham Lushbaugh, the only man who ever turned her down. Meanwhile, Rose believes she saw a UFO fly over the house.

title: Yokel Hero
description: Rose is nominated for the St. Olaf Woman of the Year award, while Blanche and Dorothy embellish her accomplishments on her entry form.

title: Bang the Drum, Stanley
description: When Sophia gets hit in the head by a baseball at a game, Stan encourages her to exaggerate her injuries to try and get a class action settlement out of it.

title: Sophia's Wedding: Part 1
description: When Sophia's friend Esther Weinstock dies, she goes to her funeral in Brooklyn. There, she confronts Esther's widower, Max, whom Sophia blames for the failure of her husband's old business.

title: Sophia's Wedding: Part 2
description: Newlyweds Max and Sophia open a pizza knish stand on the beach, while Dorothy has gotten into the habit of smoking cigarettes.

title: Brother, Can You Spare That Jacket?
description: Sophia donates an old jacket to charity, not knowing that it contains a winning lottery ticket.

title: Scared Straight
description: Blanche's brother Clayton is afraid to admit his homosexuality, so he claims he slept with Rose.

title: Stan Takes a Wife
description: When Sophia is hospitalized with pneumonia, Stan comforts Dorothy. At the hospital, she sees a side of him that impresses her, and she tries to prevent him from getting married again to another woman.

title: The Auction
description: The girls need a new roof, so they scheme to buy and then sell a painting by Jasper DeKimmel, an arrogant painter who has a few days to live.

title: Blind Date
description: Blanche makes a date with a man without realizing that he is blind.

title: The Impotence of Being Ernest
description: Rose tries to do something about her boyfriend's sexual dysfunction.

title: Love Me Tender
description: Dorothy dates a short, bald man with whom she has nothing in common - except for great lovemaking. Meanwhile, Rose and Blanche volunteer as big sisters for two teenage girls.

title: Valentine's Day
description: The girls Valentine's Day dates all stand them up, so they sit around, eat cheesecake, and look back at memorable Valentine's Days past.

title: Two Rode Together
description: Dorothy takes Sophia to Walt Disney World for "quality time," but Sophia wants to ride Space Mountain instead. Meanwhile, Rose and Blanche collaborate on a children's book.

title: You Gotta Have Hope
description: Rose is convinced that Bob Hope is her real father and that he will perform as the Master of Ceremonies at an upcoming charity benefit.

title: Fiddler on the Ropes
description: Sophia is given money that is intended to be put into a Certificate of Deposit, but she buys a Cuban prizefighter instead.

title: Till Death Do We Volley
description: Dorothy blames herself when her friend and former classmate Trudy dies suddenly while playing tennis.

title: High Anxiety
description: Rose tries to overcome her addiction to painkillers. Meanwhile, Dorothy and Sophia appear in a TV commercial for a pizzeria.

title: Little Sister
description: Nobody believes Rose when she says that she saw her sister Holly making out with Blanche's boyfriend.

title: Sophia's Choice
description: Sophia breaks her friend Lillian out of a retirement home that is worse than Shady Pines was. Meanwhile, Blanche decides to use her work bonus to have her breasts enlarged.

title: Rites of Spring
description: As the girls vow to get in shape for an upcoming beach party, they recall past attempts at self-improvement.

title: Foreign Exchange
description: Two friends of Sophia's come to visit from Sicily with the revelation that Dorothy and their daughter, Gina, may have been switched at birth.

title: We're Outta Here: Part 1
description: A wealthy Japanese businessman offers to buy the house.

title: We're Outta Here: Part 2
description: The girls plan to accept a generous offer for the house.

title: Sick and Tired: Part 1
description: Dorothy says that she is seriously ill, but none of the doctors she sees believe her.

title: Sick and Tired: Part 2
description: Dorothy learns that she has Chronic Fatigue Syndrome.

title: The Accurate Conception
description: Blanche's daughter Rebecca shocks her with her plans to conceive a baby by means of artificial insemination.

title: Rose Fights Back
description: When Rose loses her pension fund, she must get a second job to support herself. A local TV station hires her as an assistant to Enrique Mas, an egotistical consumer reporter.

title: Love Under the Big Top
description: Ken Whittingham, Dorothy's lawyer boyfriend, wants to give up his law practice and become a circus clown.

title: Dancing in the Dark
description: Rose feels inferior to her boyfriend Miles, a college professor.

title: Not Another Monday
description: Martha Lamont, one of Sophia's close friends, is tired of the physical pain and suffering in her life and wants to kill herself.

title: That Old Feeling
description: Blanche falls in love with her late husband's brother Jamie.

title: Comedy of Errors
description: After a high school classmate dies unexpectedly, Dorothy decides to fulfill a long-forgotten dream of being a stand-up comedian.

title: All That Jazz
description: Dorothy's son Michael moves in with her after his wife kicks him out.

title: Ebb Tide
description: Blanche and her sister Virginia clash at Big Daddy's funeral, which Dorothy also attends. Meanwhile, Sophia takes advantage of their absences to rent their rooms out to boarders.

title: Have Yourself a Very Little Christmas
description: The girls volunteer at a homeless shelter on Christmas day and learn that Stan has been thrown out on the streets by his current wife.

title: Mary Has a Little Lamb
description: The girls try to reconcile a pregnant teenage girl and her father. Meanwhile, Blanche starts to regret having written sympathetic "love" letters to a man in jail.

title: Great Expectations
description: Blanche is afraid to get too close to her boyfriend, even after he suffers a heart attack.

title: Triple Play
description: Miles' daughter tells Rose to stop seeing him, Sophia has received over $100,000 in Social Security checks, and Blanche rents a car and pretends to sell it so that she can meet men.

title: Clinton Avenue Memoirs
description: Sophia is suffering from memory problems so decides to make a trip back to her old Brooklyn home in the hope of rekindling her fading past.

title: Like the Beep Beep Beep of the Tom Tom
description: Blanche feels insecure about her body after having a pacemaker installed.

title: An Illegitimate Concern
description: A young man shocks Blanche when he shows up unannounced from Dallas, Texas and tells him that her late husband George was his father.

title: 72 Hours
description: Rose is afraid that a blood transfusion she had several years ago may have contained HIV-infected blood.

title: Twice in a Lifetime
description: Rose's old boyfriend Buzz, a musician with Spike Jones' band, shows up and wants to get back together with her.

title: Sisters and Other Strangers
description: Blanche thinks the risqué novel her sister Charmaigne has written is about her. Meanwhile, Dorothy argues with Stan's Czechoslovakian cousin Magda over Communism.

title: Cheaters
description: Dorothy rekindles her romance with Glenn O'Brien, the married (now divorced) man she had an affair with several years ago.

title: The Mangiacavallo Curse Makes a Lousy Wedding Present
description: Sophia must confront a man that she put a curse on after he jilted her at the altar decades ago.

title: All Bets Off
description: Dorothy falls back into patterns of habitual gambling that she thought she had kicked several years ago.

title: The President's Coming! The President's Coming! Part 1
description: All the girls except Dorothy are excited when President George H.W. Bush plans to visit their house on his tour of Miami.

title: The President's Coming! The President's Coming! Part 2
description: A Secret Service agent comes to the house to make sure none of the girls pose a threat to the President's security.

title: Blanche Delivers
description: Blanche's pregnant daughter Rebecca comes to Miami to have her baby.

title: Once in St. Olaf
description: While Sophia is in the hospital, Rose is reunited with her biological father.

title: If at Last You Do Succeed
description: When Stan finally has a successful business venture, he grows tired of being browbeaten by Dorothy.

title: Snap Out of It
description: Dorothy tries to convince an aging hippie shut-in to come out of his apartment.

title: Wham, Bam, Thank You, Mammy
description: Blanche's former nanny, Viola Watkins, reveals a shocking fact about Big Daddy.

title: Feelings
description: Dorothy attracts severe criticism for refusing to pass a star football player in the high school English Literature course which she is teaching.

title: Zborn Again
description: Dorothy resists Stan's attempts at reconciliation after he finally hits it big; Rose asks Sophia for help with dealing with an annoying co-worker.

title: How Do You Solve a Problem Like Sophia?
description: Sophia decides to become a nun to honor a friend who recently passed away.

title: Mrs. George Devereaux
description: Blanche's late husband George suddenly turns up, claiming to have faked his own death, while Dorothy finds herself caught in a love triangle with two celebrities.

title: Girls Just Wanna Have Fun... Before They Die
description: Sophia asks Blanche for tips on how to please her boyfriend Tony.

title: Stand by Your Man
description: Blanche makes a date with a man she meets at a library, not realizing that he is confined to a wheelchair.

title: Ebbtide's Revenge
description: When Sophia's son Phil dies, she must deal with her animosity towards his widow, Angela.

title: The Bloom Is Off the Rose
description: Rose and Miles decide that they need more adventure in their relationship, so they take up skydiving.

title: Sister of the Bride
description: Blanche's homosexual brother, Clayton, plans a commitment ceremony with his boyfriend, Doug.

title: Miles to Go
description: Rose learns that her boyfriend Miles is really Nicholas Carbone, a mob witness relocated to Miami by the Witness Protection Program.

title: There Goes the Bride: Part 1
description: Dorothy and Stan decide to remarry.

title: There Goes the Bride: Part 2
description: As Dorothy and Stan plan their wedding, the other girls interview potential new roommates.

title: Older and Wiser
description: Sophia becomes the recreational director at a senior center.

title: Melodrama
description: After fearing him dead, Blanche wants her relationship with Mel Bushman to become more serious.

title: Even Grandmas Get the Blues
description: To land a man at an audition for a production of "The Taming of the Shrew," Blanche pretends that her baby granddaughter Aurora is really her own child.

title: Witness
description: As Rose moves on with her life, Miles' sudden return complicates matters with her new boyfriend.

title: What a Difference a Date Makes
description: Dorothy learns that Sophia turned away her prom date John, who is now in Miami, because of the way he was dressed. When she told her that he stood her up, Dorothy lost all her self-esteem and went out with Stan because of this.

title: Love for Sale
description: Stan wins a date with Dorothy at a charity auction.

title: Never Yell Fire in a Crowded Retirement Home: Part 1
description: Police suspect that Sophia may be responsible for the fire that destroyed the Shady Pines Retirement Home.

title: Never Yell Fire in a Crowded Retirement Home: Part 2
description: Sophia cannot recall the events that lead to the Shady Pines fire.

title: Henny Penny - Straight, No Chaser
description: When the entire cast catches the Measles, the girls must take their places in the class play.

title: Hey, Look Me Over
description: Rose gets a big shock when she develops some old film she discovers in one of Charley's cameras.

title: The Case of the Libertine Belle
description: A murder mystery weekend turns deadly, and Blanche is the prime suspect in a real-life murder.

title: Beauty and the Beast
description: Blanche pushes her granddaughter Melissa into a beauty pageant she doesn't want to participate in. Meanwhile, an injured Sophia bonds with her nurse.

title: That's for Me to Know
description: Dorothy learns that her father was not Sophia's first husband.

title: Where's Charlie?
description: Rose is convinced Charlie is communicating with her from beyond the grave; Blanche dates a baseball coach.

title: Mother Load
description: Blanche faces off against the mother of her latest boyfriend over his affections; Stan convinces Dorothy to join him in therapy.

title: Dateline: Miami
description: While Dorothy goes out on a date, Rose, Blanche, and Sophia stay at home and recall past dates that they've had.

title: The Monkey Show
description: Stan, whose mother recently passed away, transfers his affections for Sophia onto a stuffed monkey at the request of his psychiatrist.

title: Ro$e Love$ Mile$
description: Rose is annoyed with Miles' frugal ways, so Blanche takes her out on a double date with two big spenders.

title: Room Seven
description: Blanche goes to Atlanta to try and halt the demolition of her grandmother's house. Meanwhile, Sophia's behavior becomes more reckless after a near-death experience.

title: From Here to the Pharmacy
description: Blanche dates a man who claims to have returned from military service in the Persian Gulf.

title: The Pope's Ring
description: When Pope John Paul II visits Miami, Sophia wants to see him and ask for the blessing of a sick friend.

title: Old Boyfriends
description: A man from St. Olaf visits claiming he dated Rose when they were teenagers, but she doesn't remember him as one of the many boyfriends she had in her youth.

title: Goodbye, Mr. Gordon
description: Dorothy's old high school teacher, Mr. Gordon, plagiarizes something she wrote.

title: The Commitments
description: Blanche thinks her sex appeal is fading when her boyfriend doesn't want to sleep with her. Meanwhile, Dorothy dates a musician who portrays a Beatle in "Beatlemania."

title: Questions and Answers
description: Dorothy learns that auditions for the TV game show "Jeopardy!" are coming to Miami, and she plans to try out for it. Later, she dreams of a bizarre game of Jeopardy! which pits her against Rose and her neighbor Charlie Dietz.

title: Ebbtide VI: The Wrath of Stan
description: Dorothy and Stan are accused of being slumlords by the tenants of the apartment building they jointly own.

title: Journey to the Center of Attention
description: Blanche is upset when Dorothy becomes popular with the patrons at her favorite bar, the Rusty Anchor.

title: A Midwinter Night's Dream
description: After she sees Dorothy and Miles' spur-of-the-moment kiss, Sophia must tell this to Rose; the last thing she needs to do to break the curse is tell a friend of a betrayal.

title: Rose: Portrait of a Woman
description: Miles' birthday is coming up, so Blanche convinces Rose to present him a naughty picture of herself as a gift. Meanwhile, Dorothy lands a highly-paid new job teaching adults, much to Sophia's delight.

title: Home Again, Rose: Part 1
description: While pretending to be people they picked at random from a yearbook at a high school reunion, Rose suffers a heart attack.

title: Home Again, Rose: Part 2
description: As Rose prepares for a triple coronary bypass, she makes the girls promise to have their heads cryogenically preserved when they die.

title: One Flew Out of the Cuckoo's Nest
description: As Dorothy and Lucas prepare to get married, they try to persuade Sophia to come live with them in Atlanta.
